summary:
The Security Council,
Reaffirming the purposes and principles of the Charter of the United Nations and its relevant resolutions, particularly resolution 1373 (2001), 
 Condemns in the strongest terms the bomb attacks in Istanbul, Turkey, on 15 and 20 November 2003, and other terrorist acts, regarding them as threats to peace and security. 
 Expresses deepest sympathy and condolences to the people and Governments of Turkey and the United Kingdom, and to the victims and their families. 
 Urges all States to cooperate in finding and bringing to justice the perpetrators, organizers, and sponsors of these attacks, in accordance with resolution 1373 (2001). 
 Expresses its reinforced determination to combat all forms of terrorism, in accordance with its responsibilities under the Charter.
